author: Staff Reporter
text:
Cases were registered against 18 persons for conducting erudattam despite the ban on jallikattu, in Nallampalli.

Cases were registered after a complaint was made out by the Village Administrative Officer of Narthampatty village of Nallampalli panchayat. According to sources, the locals were stopped by the VAO, Sasikala, when they attempted to parade the bulls ahead of a ritualistic ceremony for the local deity on Sunday evening. Yet, the locals went ahead with erudattam, despite warnings.

Following a complaint with the Adhiyamankottai police here, cases were registered against 15 persons including the former panchayat union chairman of Nallampalli. Similarly, three persons were booked for violence during an erudattam conducted in Dharmapuri on Sunday evening.
title: 18 persons booked for conducting erudattam
